thread.title: Sandra Spuzich, 1966 US Women's Open golf winner, dies
thread.title_full: Sandra Spuzich, 1966 US Women's Open golf winner, dies

title: Sandra Spuzich, 1966 US Women's Open golf winner, dies
text: Sandra Spuzich, 1966 US Women's Open golf winner, dies Updated 4:21 pm, Monday, October 12, 2015 INDIANAPOLIS (AP) â€” Sandra Spuzich, the 1966 U.S. Women's Open champion who won six other LPGA Tour titles, has died. She was 78. Conkle Funeral Homes and the U.S. Golf Association said Spuzich died Oct. 6 at her Indianapolis home. Spuzich won the Women's Open at Hazeltine in Minnesota for her first tour title, beating Carol Mann by a stroke. In 1982, Spuzich won the Corning Classic and Mary Kay Classic at age 45 to became the oldest player in LPGA Tour history to win twice in a season, a record that still stands. Spuzich is survived by her longtime partner, former LPGA Tour player Joyce Kazmierski . Southeast Texas sports news
